intro: Galium valdepilosum subsp. slesvicense, commonly known as the Slesvian bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
